item.title: A Soldier And A Father
item.description: By profession I am a soldier and take pride in that fact. But I am prouder — infinitely prouder — to be a father. A soldier destroys in order to build; the father only builds, never destroys. The one has the potentiality of death; the other embodies creation and life. And while the hordes of death are mighty, the battalions of life are mightier still. It is my hope that my son, when I am gone, will remember me not from the battle but in the home repeating with him our simple daily prayer, “Our Father who art in heaven.

item.title: Bravery
item.description: Bravery is the capacity to perform properly even when scared half to death. – Gen. Omar Bradley (source)

item.title: Commander In Chief
item.description: It follows that any commander in chief who undertakes to carry out a plan which he considers defective is at fault; he must put forth his reasons, insist of the plan being changed, and finally tender his resignation rather than be the instrument of his army’s downfall. – Napoleon (“Military Maxims and Thought”)

item.title: Cost of Freedom
item.description: The cost of freedom is always high, but Americans have always paid it. And one path we shall never choose, and that is the path of surrender, or submission. – John F. Kennedy

item.title: Dogs of Fallujah
item.description: May the dogs of Fallujah feast hearty on the remains of our fallen enemies. – USMC

item.title: Get Out Of My Way
item.description: Lead me, follow me, or get out of my way. – Gen. George S. Patton

item.title: Great Simplifiers
item.description: Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers who can cut through the argument, debate, and doubt to offer a solution everybody can understand. – Gen. Colin Powell (source)

item.title: Measure A Man's Success
item.description: I don’t measure a man’s success by how high he climbs but how high he bounces when he hits bottom. – Gen. George S. Patton Jr. (source)

item.title: Military Bureaucracies
item.description: According to Science Fiction writer Robert Heinlein, “all military bureaucracies consist of a Surprise Party Department, a Practical Joke Department, and a Fairy Godmother Department. The first two process most matters, as the third is very small…[consisting] of one elderly G5 female clerk, usually out on sick leave.” So of course your orders were processed by the Practical Joke and/or Surprise Party Depts. – Robert Heinlein

item.title: Motivation
item.description: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it. – Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower (source)

item.title: Strategy And Character
item.description: Leadership is a potent combination of strategy and character. But if you must be without one, be without the strategy. – Gen. Norman Schwarzkopf, Jr. (source)

item.title: Warrior In A Garden
item.description: A student said to his master: “You teach me fighting, but you talk of peace. How do you reconcile the two?” The master replied: “It is better to be a warrior in a garden than to be a gardener in a war.” – Unknown (source)
